Package ZuulBad

Class Player

java.lang.Object
ZuulBad.Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
This class creates the character which is controlled by the user. It has properties that need to be satisfied such as lifeBar and foodBar in order for the game to continue. An instance of the class Inventory is used to store the items the player can carry.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sarah Engelmayer

  • Property Details

    • lifeBar

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty lifeBarProperty
      Getter for the lifeBar Property variable. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').
      Returns:
      The value of lifeBar

    • foodBar

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty foodBarProperty
      Getter for the foodBar Property variable. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').
      Returns:
      The value of foodBar

    • backpackWeight

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty backpackWeightProperty
      Getter for the Property variable of the actual weight of the player's backpack. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').

  • Field Details

    • maxFood

      private int maxFood
      The maximum value the FoodBar of the player can reach. This variable is created for a graphical aspect. The rectangles that represents the foodBar should not become too long.

    • maxLife

      private int maxLife
      The maximum value the LifeBar of the player can reach. This variable is created for a graphical aspect. The rectangles that represents the foodBar should not become too long.

    • backpack

      private Inventory backpack
      An instance of Inventory representing the backpack of the player. With this he/she can store transportable items.

    • lifeBar

      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty lifeBar
      The points of life a player has. Demonstrating the health of the player. The lower the value is the weaker is the player. If monsters cause damage on the player, the lifebar is reduced. Going through rooms (and not getting attacked) the player regenerates and lifebar increases.

    • foodBar

      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty foodBar
      The points of food a player has. Demonstrating the hunger a player has. The lower the value is the hungrier is the player. Walking through rooms, the player gets hungry and foodBar decreases. Eating food, foodbar increases.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Initializes the lifeBar, foodBar and backpack of the player.

  • Method Details

    • lifeBarProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty lifeBarProperty()
      Getter for the lifeBar Property variable. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').
      Returns:
      The value of lifeBar

    • foodBarProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty foodBarProperty()
      Getter for the foodBar Property variable. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').
      Returns:
      The value of foodBar

    • backpackWeightProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty backpackWeightProperty()
      Getter for the Property variable of the actual weight of the player's backpack. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').

    • backpackContainsItem

      public boolean backpackContainsItem​(Item specificitem)
      Answers the question if the player's backpack contains a specific item or not.
      Parameters:
      specificitem - The item about which we want to know if it is in backpack or not.
      Returns:
      'true' if the item is in the backpack, 'false' if not

    • eatFoodFromBackpack

      public void eatFoodFromBackpack​(Food food)
      A food item of the player's backpack is eaten. The player's foodBar is increased when eating a food.
      Parameters:
      food - The food that should be eaten.

    • getPowerFromMuffin

      public java.lang.String getPowerFromMuffin()
      The player gets the strength to carry an unlimited weight in his backpack. Called when eating a magic muffin. Sets the maxWeight of inventory to an infinite value.
      Returns:
      a message that says that from now on there is no limit of the weight carried in the player's backpack.

    • putItemIntoBackpack

      public boolean putItemIntoBackpack​(Item item)
      An item is put into the player's backpack provided that it does not exceed the backpacks capacity (maxWeight).
      Parameters:
      item - The item that should be put into the player's backpack.
      Returns:
      'true' if the item was stored in the player's backpack, 'false' if not.

    • removeItemFromBackpack

      public boolean removeItemFromBackpack​(Item item)
      The player removes an item of his/her backpack.
      Parameters:
      item - The item that should be removed
      Returns:
      'true' if the item was removed, 'false' if not.

    • hasWeapon

      public boolean hasWeapon()
      Answers the question if the player's backpack contains a arbitrary backpack or not.
      Returns:
      'true' if the player's backpack contains a arbitrary backpack, 'false' if not.

    • removeAWeaponFromBackpack

      public void removeAWeaponFromBackpack()
      The player removes an weapon from his/her backpack.

    • getBackpackContent

      public java.lang.String getBackpackContent()
      Provides a string that lists all the items in the player's backpack at the moment.
      Returns:
      the string that lists all the items in the player's backpack at the moment.

    • cantCarryMore

      public boolean cantCarryMore​(int itemWeight)
      Answers the question if the player can carry another item more in his/her backpack. If this item would exceed the maximum portable weight of the backpack, the player can't pick it up and store it in his/her backpack.
      Parameters:
      itemWeight - the weight of the item that should be put into the backpack
      Returns:
      'false' if the item can be put into the backpack, 'true' if the player can't carry it.

    • getBackpacksFreeWeight

      public int getBackpacksFreeWeight()
      A getter for the remaining free weight of the player's backpack.
      Returns:
      the remaining free weight of the player's backpack.

    • increaseFoodBar

      public void increaseFoodBar()
      increases the player's foodBar. Used when player eats food. Every food increases the player's foodBar by 5 units.

    • getHungry

      public void getHungry()
      reduces foodBar of player by 1 unit. Simulates that over time player gets hungry. Used after every entry in a room.

    • starvedToDeath

      public boolean starvedToDeath()
      Answers the question if the player starved to death and his/her foodBar is less or equal than zero.
      Returns:
      'true' if the player starved to death. 'False' if his/her foodBar is still greater than zero.

    • beaten

      public boolean beaten()
      Answers the question if the player is beaten by a monster and his/her lifeBar is less or equal than zero.
      Returns:
      'true' if the player is beaten. 'False' if his/her lifeBar is still greater than zero.

    • increaseLifeBar

      public void increaseLifeBar()
      increases lifeBar of the player. Simulates regeneration of players health over time (used after every entry in a room).

    • reduceLifeBar

      public void reduceLifeBar​(int amount)
      reduces lifeBar of the player. Used when a monster attacks and no weapon is available in the player's backpack to fight it.
      Parameters:
      amount - , how much the player's lifeBar is reduced. Corresponds to the damage value of the monster.

    • getMaxFood

      public int getMaxFood()
      A getter for the maximum value of the player's foodBar.
      Returns:
      the maximum value of the player's foodBar.

    • getMaxLife

      public int getMaxLife()
      A getter for the maximum value of the player's lifeBar.
      Returns:
      the maximum value of the player's lifeBar.

    • getMaxWeight

      public int getMaxWeight()
      A getter for the maximum portable weight of the player's backpack.
      Returns:
      the maximum portable weight of the player's backpack.
